links.description: If one or more settings stored in NVRAM don't work as expected on an Intel-based Mac, resetting NVRAM might help.

links.name: Remove a device from Find Devices on iCloud.com
links.description: You can use Find Devices on iCloud.com to temporarily remove a device from the Devices list or turn off Activation Lock on a device you already gave away or sold.

links.name: How to back up your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch
links.description: If you back up your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch, you'll have a copy of your information to use in case your device is ever replaced, lost, or damaged.

links.name: Reset the SMC of your Mac
links.description: The SMC is responsible for managing power on your Intel-based Mac. Resetting it can resolve certain uncommon issues related to power or thermal management.

links.name: Set up iCloud on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch
links.description: To set up iCloud on your devices, sign in to each of them with the same Apple ID and password. You can choose which apps store information in iCloud and which iCloud features you're using separately on each device. Learn more about how each app or feature uses iCloud.
